meanings.definition: To swear more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the argument, John kept outswearing his friend.
meanings.sent2: She was outswearing everyone in the room with her colorful language.
meanings.sent3: The competition was to see who could outswear the loudest without getting in trouble.
meanings.sent4: His outswearing echoed through the empty hallway, startling passersby.
meanings.sent5: The outswearing contest at the party was both amusing and shocking.

meanings.sent1: The comedian was outswearing the audience, making them laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: He was outswearing so much that his friends had to ask him to tone it down.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to outswear its owner, much to the amusement of visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her outswearing was like a storm of colorful words, leaving everyone speechless.
meanings.sent5: The outswearing in the movie was so frequent that it became distracting.
